info.name: Optic nerve, chiasm, tract
info.description: The Optic Nerve fibers (Cranial Nerve II) travel from the retina of each eye toward the brain.  There is a partial crossing of the nerve fibers in the Optic Chiasm.  Beyond the chiasm, the nerve fibers accumulate in the Optic Tract.  The Optic Tract then carries the visual information from the contralateral visual field to the Lateral Geniculate nucleus of the thalamus and beyond to the Visual Cortex.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Whole Brain/Sagittal & Parasagittal/2 Sag Thin Sec
/Sections/Thin, Whole Brain/Sagittal & Parasagittal/3 Sag Thin Sec
